article.title: Working with External Models in Simphony

section.title: Overview
section.para: Included with Repast Simphony is support for sending data out to files and reading data in from files based on an xml description of the files' contents. These xml descriptor files are designed to specify any text files, as long as they have some logical data specification. With this it is possible to have data in a Java Bean

The data file specification uses a small set of four xml tags. Through the nesting of this small set of tags, arbitrarily complex file formats can be specified. The tags and their uses are specified in Table 1.
